title: Foundations of Financial Vulnerability Prediction Modeling in Emerging Economies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical concepts and ability to interpret economic indicators
context.additional_context: Professional development program for pre-service or in-service teachers to enhance teaching competencies, with a focus on practical data analysis skills for working professionals

learning_goals: Learners will explain the five core variables (GDP growth rate, inflation, interest rate, monetary policy, bank capital adequacy ratio) of a financial vulnerability prediction model for emerging economies, focusing on BRICS nations.
Learners will implement step-by-step a predictive model design process using BPNN (Backpropagation Neural Network) and PCA (Principal Component Analysis) techniques.
Learners will validate model accuracy using historical data and write interpretation reports.

resources: PPT Template and Model Evaluation Rubric

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
